news.title: Gaza City gripped by famine as UN chief says ‘food stacks up at borders because of systematic obstruction by Israel’
news.summary: Gaza City and surrounding areas are officially suffering from famine, and it will likely spread, a global hunger monitor determined on Friday, an assessment that will escalate pressure on Israel to allow more aid into the Palestinian territory.

news.title: Leaving Cert 2025: Kerry twins among many students to earn maximum 625 points
The college degrees that can lead to six-figure salaries in AI-proof jobs
news.summary: The Leaving Cert results are out and college offers are around the corner. Will three or four years of lectures and tens of thousands of euro really equip students for a labour market in which artificial intelligence is advancing at breakneck speed?

news.title: ‘My identity has been stolen to produce fake AI-generated books in my name’
news.summary: We all feel sick when our credit card gets scammed or we realise we’ve visited a fake website. Imagine discovering that your identity has been hijacked and someone is trying to trade off your name.

news.title: Rhasidat Adeleke’s coach responds to Sonia O’Sullivan’s criticism of Irish track star
news.summary: Rhasidat Adeleke’s coach Edrick Floreal has addressed speculation surrounding the Dubliner’s withdrawal from the upcoming World Championships, telling the Irish Independent that she withdrew from the event in Tokyo simply due to injury.

news.title: Mary Coughlan slams Bono’s comments on Gaza as ‘putrid and pathetic’
news.summary: Mary Coughlan has thrown down the gauntlet to Bono by goading him to fly to Gaza and see first-hand the genocide being inflicted on the Palestinian people by Israel’s armed forces.

news.title: ‘I flushed my Leaving Cert results down the toilet’ –  entrepreneur Karl Fitzpatrick on his unconventional path to success
news.summary: Karl Fitzpatrick was a finalist in this year’s EY Entrepreneur Of The Year competition for his role in achieving monumental success with his online learning platform, but such an achievement was once a pipe dream.

news.title: ‘The older you get, if you slow down or stop – you’re f***ed... If you’re enjoying it, play away’
news.summary: “When you’re ringing lads like me in their 40s, things must be bad,” is the first quip that comes out of Donncha O’Connor’s mouth, but the former Cork football star is as relevant as ever.

news.title: Bill Linnane: How I bribed my 17-year-old son to come on a week-long family holiday with us
news.summary: Convincing a teenager to be anywhere in public with you is hard. Convincing them to go on holiday with you for a week is even harder. And it is harder again to convince them to go on holiday with you when you are holidaying in Ireland.

news.title: Modern Morals: 'My friend confided in me about a rocky patch in her marriage - but then she told her husband what I said about him'
